intro: Sedum reticulatum, commonly known as the netleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves arranged in a rosette pattern, which help it store water and survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its adaptability and low maintenance requirements make it an excellent addition to drought-tolerant landscapes.
